items.sentence: I promised Tom I wouldn't stay in Australia for more than three days.
I just heard Tom and Mary are coming back to Australia for Christmas.
Everybody thought that Tom was going to be in Australia this weekend.
Does Tom still think that Mary would like to go to Australia with us?
Tom thought Mary was in Australia, but she was really in New Zealand.
Tom told me he thought Mary still wanted to go to Australia with him.
Are you sure it was Tom you spoke to? Could it have been his brother?
He is a busy man, so you can only get in touch with him by telephone.
I got the impression Tom wasn't happy with the way things turned out.
Tom says he usually has at least three hundred dollars in his wallet.
Tom's legs were seriously injured, but he managed to crawl to safety.
Tom opened the envelope, took out the letter, and started to read it.
I don't think that I can get you to understand how difficult that is.
Questioned about his policies, the candidate gave only vague answers.
I left home later than usual, but I was still able to catch my train.
Tom realized he didn't have enough money to buy everything he wanted.
Tom realized he didn't have enough time to do what needed to be done.
Stay as far away as possible from anybody that you think may be sick.
I don't think Tom knows what time I'm going to arrive at the station.
I don't think it's very likely Tom will come over this time of night.
